column4: Can someone tell me how to restart xorg, I think that may be the problem

hit ctrl-alt-F1, that will take you to a console, log in, then type sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop, then type sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start. that should restart you xorg, you may have to hit ctrl-alt-F7 but I don't think so.
That didn't seem to fix my problem, my window controls aren't showing, my windows are going over my panels and I can't move anything.
r you using compiz? try to run this: metacity from a command prompt
Yes I'm using compiz but it's not working either right now, also I don't know how I can access Terminal because this chat window is blocking my menus and I can't move it out of the way
hit ctrl-F2, that'll bring up a run box, type in gnome-terminal
Nothing opened, however I tried running metacity in Ctrl Alt F1 and it said it was unable to start the window manager
hitting ctrl-F2 didn't open a  little run box?
Normally it does but ever since this happened I can't get it to open
it should. i am not sure and I have to get to bed now. sorry to all.
one last suggestion would be to restart your machine. gotta go now.
I tried that and it didn't work
wait, did you try ctrl-alt-F7, that should take you to the gui session. ctrl-alt-F1 thru F6 are just tty's consoles.
ctrl alt f7 doesn't do anything
you can't run metacity from tty1 bcause X isn't running on that console. you ahve to run metacity from tty7.
because you're most liekly already in tty7
